docs.snippet: As native advertising gains prominence, publishers may find themselves competing not just with one another, but with the ad agencies that already exist.

headline.print_headline: In Media Company Advertising, Sponsored Content Is Becoming King
headline.main: How Sponsored Content Is Becoming King in a Facebook World

docs.abstract: Role and definition of sponsored content offered by publishers to advertisers has shifted as publishers and social media platforms develop closer relationships; publishers are now facing heightened expectations from advertisers, who no longer are solely reliant on publishers for distribution.

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc. will not become a media company, its founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg said on Monday, telling students the firm would remain a technology platform.

headline.print_headline: Facebook CEO Says Group Will Not Become a Media Company
headline.main: Facebook CEO Says Group Will Not Become a Media Company

docs.snippet: The party, in an effort to appeal to Palestinians ahead of hotly contested elections, also claimed to have “offered 170,000 martyrs.”

headline.print_headline: Fatah Makes Public Claim That It Killed  11,000 Israelis
headline.main: Fatah Makes Incendiary Facebook Claim of Killing 11,000 Israelis

docs.abstract: Palestinian Pres Mahmoud Abbas's Fatah party cites having killed 11,000 Israelis among its accomplishments ahead of contentious elections; critics say claim. made on Facebook post in Arabic, reflects Abbas's habit of promoting peace to English audiences but advocating violence to his Arab-speaking supporters.

docs.snippet: Pope Francis has met with Facebook founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Zuckerberg's wife, Priscilla Chan, at the Vatican.

headline.print_headline: Pope Francis Chats in Person With Facebook CEO Zuckerberg
headline.main: Pope Francis Chats in Person With Facebook CEO Zuckerberg

docs.snippet: Facebook is taking new steps to reduce the role of human judgment in its "Trending Topics" feature, which drew controversy earlier this year over claims the service was suppressing conservative views.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Reduces Role of Human Editors in 'Trending Topics'
headline.main: Facebook Reduces Role of Human Editors in 'Trending Topics'

docs.snippet: Kansas City police are trying to determine whether an officer posted on Facebook that the killing of an unarmed black man by a white Oklahoma police officer was a "good shoot."

headline.print_headline: Kansas City Police Investigate 'Good Shoot' Facebook Post
headline.main: Kansas City Police Investigate 'Good Shoot' Facebook Post

docs.snippet: Britain's data privacy regulator said on Friday it would monitor how popular messaging service WhatsApp shares data with parent Facebook Inc under a new privacy policy.

headline.print_headline: UK Regulator to Monitor WhatsApp's Data Sharing With Facebook
headline.main: UK Regulator to Monitor WhatsApp's Data Sharing With Facebook

docs.snippet: Global messaging service WhatsApp says it will start sharing the phone numbers of its users with Facebook, its parent company. That means WhatsApp users could soon start seeing more targeted ads and Facebook friend suggestions on Facebook based on...

headline.print_headline: WhatsApp Is Going to Share Your Phone Number With Facebook
headline.main: WhatsApp Is Going to Share Your Phone Number With Facebook

docs.snippet: Swiss media are reporting that a wingsuit flyer who fatally crashed in the Alps on Friday was broadcasting live on Facebook when the accident happened.

headline.print_headline: Wingsuit Flyer's Death Reportedly Streamed Live on Facebook
headline.main: Wingsuit Flyer's Death Reportedly Streamed Live on Facebook

docs.snippet: A tongue-in-cheek Facebook page invites people to apologize to the country for real or perceived slights.

headline.print_headline: A Facebook Page to Let China Know You’re Sorry
headline.main: Sorry for Having Insulted China? Here’s Your Chance to Apologize
